body_html:
I've changed the fuser to make it treat nodes in different blocks as not fusable. Regarding peephole, I don't think any of the optimizations we have at the moment require any changes, because we only:

  1. replace values produced in a current block with values form previous blocks
  2. do 1. and remove nodes from previous blocks if and only if they are no longer used anywhere else.

I've added a comment mentioning that if someone was to make a simplification that would replace a subgraph of some kind, then they will need to take extra care to ensure that all nodes are in the same block.

body:
I've changed the fuser to make it treat nodes in different blocks as not fusable. Regarding peephole, I don't think any of the optimizations we have at the moment require any changes, because we only:
1. replace values produced in a current block with values form previous blocks
2. do 1. and remove nodes from previous blocks if and only if they are no longer used anywhere else.

I've added a comment mentioning that if someone was to make a simplification that would replace a subgraph of some kind, then they will need to take extra care to ensure that all nodes are in the same block.
